claim: Flublok is produced using a novel production platform in which recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS).

extracted_evidence.quote: It contains purified ha proteins produced in a continuous insect cell line (expresSF+®) that is derived rom Sf9 cells of the fall army worm, Spodoptera frug i per da (which is related to moths, caterpillars and butterflies), and grown in serum free medium composed of chemically- defined lipids, vitamins, amino acids, and mineral salts. Each of the three HAs is d ihi ll li i b l i (A hlif i l expressed in this cell line using abaculo virus vector (Autograph a cali for nica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), extracted from the cells with Triton X-100 and further purified by column chromatography.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote directly describes the production platform for Flublok, stating that recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus vector system, which supports the claim.

extracted_evidence.quote: Flublok [Influenza Vaccine] is a sterile clear colorless injection containing recombina hemagglutinin (HA) proteins from three influenza viruses for intramuscular use. It contains purified ha proteins produced in a continuous insect cell line (expresSF+®) that is derived rom Sf9 cells of the fall army worm, Spodoptera frug i per da (which is related to moths, caterpillars and butterflies), and grown in serum free medium composed of chemically- defined lipids, vitamins, amino acids, and mineral salts.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote provides evidence that Flublok is produced using a novel platform involving recombinant HA expressed in insect cells, specifically the expresSF+® cell line derived from Sf9 cells.

extracted_evidence.quote: Each of the three HAs is d ihi ll li i b l i (A hlif i l expressed in this cell line using abaculo virus vector (Autograph a cali for nica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), extracted from the cells with Triton X-100 and further purified by column chromatography.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote specifies that the HA proteins are expressed in the insect cell line using a baculovirus vector, which is the core of the BEVS platform mentioned in the claim.
